meanings.definition: Confident in what one thinks or knows
meanings.sent1: She felt sure about her answer on the test.
meanings.sent2: He is always sure of himself when speaking in public.
meanings.sent3: The cat looked sure of catching the mouse in the garden.
meanings.sent4: His smile was a sure sign of his confidence.
meanings.sent5: The bright red color made the stop sign sure to grab attention.

meanings.definition: Certain to happen or be true
meanings.sent1: The sun rising in the east is a sure thing every morning.
meanings.sent2: The team's victory was a sure outcome with their strong performance.
meanings.sent3: The magician's trick was so sure to impress the audience.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was a sure indicator of her happiness.
meanings.sent5: The sound of thunder was a sure sign of an approaching storm.

meanings.sent1: He nodded sure when asked if he understood the instructions.
meanings.sent2: She spoke sure that the decision was the right one.
meanings.sent3: The child's eyes widened sure at the sight of the huge cake.
meanings.sent4: The old man smiled sure as he reminisced about his youth.
meanings.sent5: The dog wagged its tail sure as it waited for its treat.

meanings.definition: Confidently or positively certain or sure
meanings.sent1: The coach was sure that his team would win the championship.
meanings.sent2: She gave a sure answer to the difficult question.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel moved sure along the tree branch.
meanings.sent4: His sure steps showed he knew the path well.
meanings.sent5: The bright smile on her face was a sure indication of her happiness.
